page.title: 16The Llandudno Cabin Lift.
page.content: {The Llandudno Cabin Lift is the {longest in Britain. }The distance between the stations is 1596 metres. Cabins travel at 180 metres per min., taking nine minutes to reach the sum- mit from Happy Valley and vice versa. Up to 1000 passengers per hour can be carried and a cabin leaves each station every 29 seconds. Nine inter- mediate tapering steel trestles supp- ort the cable between stations, the tallest being 24m. high with a base 1.6m. square, weighing 15.3 tons. The longest span between trestles is 300m. Cabins are about 48m. above ground at certain points and are automatically spaced at minimum intervals of 86m. 675 tons of concrete were used for the foundations and the steel work weighs over 100 tons. The Cabin Lift cost just over Â£125,000.
